page.title: 01Coastal Strip, West Cornwall
page.content:
Two thirds of this block is in the sea, but the remaining land is of great beauty. The cliffs are wild and of granite covered with much lichen giving a golden colour. There are about a dozen small fishing boats in the cove at Pemberth and they catch mostly mackerel. The soil is light granite but in square 3 it is a heavier clay from a moraine. The National Trust maintains the land in Pemberth Cove.
Farming away from the cliff ground is intensive - mostly grassland, but the warm winter climate is used to grow vegetables and early spring potatoes. The livestock on the farms is mixed; sheep, dairy herds and some beef but mainly they are milking cows.
